rev.desc.rev.desc: User Mass Update to set Activity Action field will not log jornal update record
Introduce variable $mass.action for mass operations
Mass update ignores those records which user doesn't have update permission on.
rollback the change since it will disable update all function.
This issue is caused by RTE function: $L.multiselect=multiselect.selection("selected", $L.file)
so now check if row count=1 and multiselect is false, then change multiselect to true in panel add.update and template.start
update start panel, merge from PD2

Moved the variable $L.confirm.mass.del.msg from start into panel=setup.delete, initilize it only when it's needed. Changed the sequence of setup.delete and confirm.mass.delete. Modified panel=next.delete and setup.delete to select only those multi selected.
Hua: modify apps so that it will not delete record marked as HP Proprietary if user does not have the right license.
move this line "$L.bg=$G.bg" from panel "template.start" to "start" to make sure this line gets executed.
if not, on cleanup panel" $G.bg=$L.bg" will cause $G.bg equals to null because of $L.bg isn't initlized sometimes.
if mass update is update all records, to display a popup to notify user.
added panel:
check.update.all: exit: file.count.all; condition: $L.multiselect; exit:Normal: init.typecheck
file.count.all
before.update.all: to get scmsg
prompt.update.all : use apm.mb.yes.no panel to popup message box
DE3365 - Mass Complex Update in Incident Management updates all records regardless of selected records highlighted for Mass Complex Update.
Panel: incr.count
Changed the exit from "next.record" to "verify.next.record"Panel: verify.next.record
Added a decision panel called "verify.next.record" which evaluates is it is a general mass update or an update for some selected recordsPanel: next.record.multi
Added a next panel called "next.record.multi" which verifies for the next record just from the list of selected recordsPanel: verify.counter
Added a decision panel called "verify.counter" which evaluates if more than 1 record was selected. If not, then is an update of all the recordsPanel: mass.upd.flag
Added a process panel that sets the "$L.multiselect" flag to false
Panel: start
Added the following expression:$L.multiselect=false;
Hua: extend template mass for know error task
Remove duplicate fields for template update when dealing with joinfiles.
Added skip/retry options to templates when a validation failure is encountered.
S1501 Problem Management for template and complex mass update
Further changes to support template style mass updates
template mass update
positioned the first record in the selected list.
positioned the first record in the selected list.
positioned the first record in the selected list.
sss
added parameter: $INTO.OBJECT (this holds the object record)
start panel: added expression: $L.object=$INTO.OBJECT
panel: call.mass.update...passed $L.object to mass.update
Fixed the intial expressions to recognize that it was a scalar field and not an array.
Modified check for complex update to use evaluate:
evaluate(complex.update in $L.env)

descript.descript: User Mass Update to set Activity Action field will not log jornal update record
Introduce variable $mass.action for mass operations
Mass update ignores those records which user doesn't have update permission on.
rollback the change since it will disable update all function.
This issue is caused by RTE function: $L.multiselect=multiselect.selection("selected", $L.file)
so now check if row count=1 and multiselect is false, then change multiselect to true in panel add.update
update start panel, merge from PD2

Moved the variable $L.confirm.mass.del.msg from start into panel=setup.delete, initilize it only when it's needed. Changed the sequence of setup.delete and confirm.mass.delete. Modified panel=next.delete and setup.delete to select only those multi selected.
Hua: modify apps so that it will not delete record marked as HP Proprietary if user does not have the right license.
move this line "$L.bg=$G.bg" from panel "template.start" to "start" to make sure this line gets executed.
if not, on cleanup panel" $G.bg=$L.bg" will cause $G.bg equals to null because of $L.bg isn't initlized sometimes.
if mass update is update all records, to display a popup to notify user.
added panel:
check.update.all: exit: file.count.all; condition: $L.multiselect; exit:Normal: init.typecheck
file.count.all
before.update.all: to get scmsg
prompt.update.all : use apm.mb.yes.no panel to popup message box
DE3365 - Mass Complex Update in Incident Management updates all records regardless of selected records highlighted for Mass Complex Update.
Panel: incr.count

Added a decision panel called "verify.next.record" which evaluates is it is a general mass update or an update for some selected recordsPanel: next.record.multi
Added a next panel called "next.record.multi" which verifies for the next record just from the list of selected recordsPanel: verify.counter
Added a decision panel called "verify.counter" which evaluates if more than 1 record was selected. If not, then is an update of all the recordsPanel: mass.upd.flag
Added a process panel that sets the "$L.multiselect" flag to false
Panel: start
Added the following expression:$L.multiselect=falseHua: extend template mass for know error task
Remove duplicate fields for template update when dealing with joinfiles.
Added skip/retry options to templates when a validation failure is encountered.
S1501 Problem Management for template and complex mass update
Further changes to support template style mass updates
template mass update
positioned the first record in the selected list.
positioned the first record in the selected list.
positioned the first record in the selected list.
sss
added parameter: $INTO.OBJECT (this holds the object record)
start panel: added expression: $L.object=$INTO.OBJECT
panel: call.mass.update...passed $L.object to mass.update
Fixed the intial expressions to recognize that it was a scalar field and not an array.
Modified check for complex update to use evaluate:
evaluate(complex.update in $L.env)
